courseTitle: Recognizing and Responding to Intimate Partner Violence

lessonPlans.lessonTitle: Introduction: What is Intimate Partner Violence?

images.rationale: Opening hero image establishing the iceberg metaphor for the entire course journey

audio.rationale: Accessibility - full lesson narration for screen reader users

lessonPlans.lessonTitle: Who is Affected by Intimate Partner Violence?

images.rationale: Diverse silhouettes demonstrate IPV affects all populations without stereotyping
CDC statistics - 1 in 4 women, 1 in 10 men prevalence data visualization

audio.rationale: Accessibility for prevalence statistics and stereotype-breaking content

interactive.rationale: Practice identifying IPV across diverse demographics to combat stereotypes

images.rationale: Abstract overlapping circles represent interconnected abuse types without triggering imagery
Types of Abuse visual showing physical, emotional, sexual, economic categories

audio.rationale: Accessibility for abuse type definitions and examples

interactive.rationale: Practice categorizing behaviors into abuse types (physical, emotional, sexual, economic)

images.rationale: Abstract circular mandala complements (doesn't duplicate) the Power & Control Wheel diagram
Power & Control Wheel (Duluth Model) - Critical educational framework
Power & Control Wheel B&W version - Alternative view
Power & Control + Equality Wheel duo - Shows both frameworks side-by-side

audio.rationale: Accessibility for Power & Control Wheel explanation and tactics

interactive.rationale: Interactive Power & Control Wheel - click on each section to explore tactics and examples

images.rationale: Winding illuminated path represents journey through understanding IPV patterns and categories

audio.rationale: Accessibility for Johnson's Typologies and IPV categorization

interactive.rationale: Analyze case scenarios and categorize using Johnson's Typologies (Intimate Terrorism, Situational Couple Violence, etc.)

lessonPlans.lessonTitle: Case Analysis: Lois and James Sumpter

images.rationale: African American female silhouette in contemplative pose - professional reflection without depicting victimization

audio.rationale: Accessibility for case study narrative and analysis

interactive.rationale: Guided analysis of Lois and James Sumpter case using Power & Control Wheel and Johnson's Typologies
interactive.effort: 8-10 hours (detailed case narrative + framework application tools + assessment)

images.rationale: Abstract descending light rays through twilight waters - transition into deeper, more complex topics
Sexual violence prevalence statistics from CDC
Sexual Violence framework diagram showing categories and contexts
Intimate Partner Sexual Violence (IPSV) diagram

audio.rationale: Accessibility for sexual violence definitions and statistics (sensitive content)

images.rationale: Abstract pyramid structure represents rape culture pyramid concept without text or triggering imagery
Rape Culture Pyramid diagram showing continuum from subtle behaviors to violence

audio.rationale: Accessibility for rape culture pyramid explanation and societal context

interactive.rationale: Sort behaviors along the rape culture pyramid continuum from subtle to severe

lessonPlans.lessonTitle: Rape and Sexual Assault in the Context of Intimate Partner Violence

images.rationale: Hispanic Latino male silhouette in meditation pose - professional contemplation of difficult topic without depicting assault

audio.rationale: Accessibility for IPV sexual assault context and professional response strategies

interactive.rationale: Practice responding to IPV sexual assault disclosure with trauma-informed communication choices
interactive.effort: 10-15 hours (scenario tree + dialogue + branching logic + feedback)

lessonPlans.lessonTitle: The Impact of Intimate Partner Violence on Victims

images.rationale: Deep navy ocean depths with golden light rays - profound understanding with hope breaking through darkness
Impact statistics - psychological, physical, social effects of IPV on survivors

audio.rationale: Accessibility for sensitive content about trauma impact - professional tone essential
audio.approach: Professional voiceover recommended for trauma-informed tone

images.rationale: Abstract protective shield with glowing center - safety metaphor without depicting danger or threat

audio.rationale: Accessibility for safety planning steps - professional voiceover recommended for clarity and tone

interactive.rationale: Practice safety planning conversation with survivor - dialogue choices, empowerment focus, resource provision
interactive.effort: 12-15 hours (conversation simulator + safety plan builder + feedback)

lessonPlans.lessonTitle: Responding to Someone Experiencing Intimate Partner Violence

images.rationale: Two silhouettes in supportive conversation - professional trauma-informed response from helper perspective
Power & Control Wheel B&W - Framework for analyzing disclosure
Power & Control Wheel Original - Reference framework
Power & Control + Equality Wheel Duo - Both frameworks for response guidance
National Domestic Violence Hotline information for referrals

audio.rationale: Accessibility for trauma-informed response protocol - professional voiceover essential

interactive.rationale: Practice full trauma-informed response conversation with multiple pathways and feedback
interactive.effort: 15-20 hours (complex conversation tree + branching + assessment + feedback)

images.rationale: Four diverse silhouettes ascending through water toward light - triumphant emergence representing transformation and knowledge gained

videos.rationale: Text-based course with trauma-informed approach - video not recommended
reasoning: Trauma-informed: Text allows learner control over pacing and exposure to sensitive content
Professional focus: Course targets professional response skills, not survivor stories
Content type: Frameworks and concepts are effectively taught through text + static diagrams
Accessibility: Text is more accessible than video for diverse learning needs
Cost-effective: Video would add $2500-5000 without significant learning benefit

audio.approach: Hybrid - TTS for most lessons, professional voiceover for trauma-sensitive lessons
professionalVoiceoverLessons: lesson-3-1 (Impact of IPV - trauma-informed tone essential)
lesson-3-2 (Safety Planning - clarity and professionalism essential)

animations.rationale: Static diagrams + interactive components sufficient - animations not needed
reasoning: Framework diagrams (Power & Control Wheel, Rape Culture Pyramid) are already visual and clear
Interactive components provide hands-on engagement (better than passive animation)
Trauma-informed: Static imagery allows learner control, animations can be jarring
Cost-benefit: $4000-6000 investment wouldn't add significant learning value

highPriorityComponents: lesson-1-3: Interactive Power & Control Wheel hot-spot
lesson-1-5: Lois and James Sumpter case analysis
lesson-2-3: IPV sexual assault disclosure branching scenario

minimumViableProduct.description: Essential media for functional, accessible course launch
minimumViableProduct.images: Generate 13 AI images + reuse 19 source images (32 total) - $3.90
minimumViableProduct.videos: Skip - text-based course is appropriate for trauma-informed IPV training
minimumViableProduct.interactive: Implement 5 highest-priority components only: Power & Control hot-spot, Lois/James case, IPV disclosure scenario, safety planning sim, response sim - $2,200-5,000
minimumViableProduct.readyForLaunch: Yes - meets WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility with TTS, provides core learning experiences

recommended.description: Balanced approach maximizing learning impact while controlling costs
recommended.videos: Skip - not needed for this course format
recommended.audio: Hybrid approach - TTS for 9 lessons, professional voiceover for 3 trauma-sensitive lessons (3-1, 3-2, 3-3) - $300-900
recommended.animations: Skip - interactive components provide better engagement
advantages: Professional voiceover for most sensitive content enhances trauma-informed delivery
10 interactive components provide robust hands-on practice across all modules
Excellent learner engagement without excessive development cost
Maintains accessibility standards with hybrid audio approach

fullProduction.description: Maximum engagement with all 15 prioritized interactive components
fullProduction.videos: Still skip - not appropriate for trauma-informed IPV course
fullProduction.animations: Still skip - not needed given interactive investment
advantages: Professional audio quality throughout entire course
Comprehensive interactive practice opportunities in every module
Maximum learner engagement and skill development

coordination.note: This plan coordinates across all media types identified in Phase 2 analysis
sources: interactive-opportunities.json (58 opportunities identified, 15 prioritized for implementation)
image-gap-analysis.json (19 source images to reuse, 10 gaps identified)
source-images-catalog.json (19 essential framework diagrams, statistics, resources marked as KEEP)
duplicationsAvoided: Power & Control Wheel: Reusing 3 source diagram variations + AI hero image complements (doesn't duplicate) + Interactive hot-spot for hands-on exploration (no redundant video or animation)
Rape Culture Pyramid: Reusing source diagram + AI hero complements + Interactive sorting activity (no redundant video explanation)
Safety Planning: AI hero metaphor + Interactive simulation for practice (no redundant video demonstration)
Statistics: Reusing CDC infographics (no regeneration, no animated charts)
strengths: Intelligent image reuse preserves 19 evidence-based frameworks and statistics (cost savings + consistency)
Interactive components focus on skill practice (not passive consumption)
Trauma-informed approach throughout (learner control, professional perspective, empowering imagery)
Accessibility addressed with audio narration plan (TTS or professional based on budget)
No redundant media - each type serves distinct purpose

images.altText: Required for all 32 images - descriptive alt text must be authored during Phase 3
images.colorContrast: All text in images must meet 4.5:1 ratio
images.textAlternatives: Source framework diagrams have text descriptions in lesson content

audio.transcripts: All audio narration must have full text transcripts (lesson content serves as transcript)
audio.volumeControls: Media player must have accessible volume controls

interactive.keyboardNav: All 15 interactive components must be fully keyboard navigable
interactive.screenReader: ARIA labels and roles required for all interactive elements
interactive.errorMessages: Accessible error and success messages required

accessibilityCompliance.plan: Full accessibility audit required in Phase 4 after all media integrated

traumaInformedValidation.imageContent: ✅ Empowering imagery (professional helper perspective, not victim perspective)
traumaInformedValidation.imageMetaphors: ✅ Abstract representations (icebergs, journeys, shields) for difficult concepts
traumaInformedValidation.videoApproach: ✅ No videos (text allows learner control over pacing and exposure)
traumaInformedValidation.audioTone: ✅ Professional voiceover for trauma-sensitive lessons (calm, empowering tone)
traumaInformedValidation.interactiveFocus: ✅ Professional skill practice (not survivor experience simulation)
traumaInformedValidation.learnerControl: ✅ All media allows learner to pause, skip, or revisit at their own pace
traumaInformedValidation.contentWarnings: ⚠️ To be added in Phase 4 - content warnings before sensitive modules

phase3.priority: Generate images (13 AI) + Copy reused images (19) - 2.17 hours, $3.90
phase3.deliverable: All 32 images ready for Phase 4 HTML integration

phase4.priority: Integrate images + Implement 5-10 highest-priority interactive components
phase4.deliverable: Functional course with images, interactive practice, and HTML structure

phase5Plus.priority: Add professional voiceover (if budget allows) + Implement remaining interactive components
phase5Plus.deliverable: Enhanced course with professional audio and comprehensive interactivity
